title: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ New York DMV Driver (D) Practice Test

test.question: You may cross a single solid white line in the highway:
test.A: A. Whenever you want to
test.B: B. If traffic conditions require
test.C: C. Only to turn into a driveway
test.D: D. Only to make a u-turn

test.question: As you near an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow.  Your best action would be to:
test.A: A. Speed up to beat the red light
test.B: B. Apply the brakes sharply to stop
test.C: C. Be prepared to stop in the center of the intersection
test.D: D. Be prepared to stop before the intersection

test.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other three?
test.A: A. A steady red light
test.B: B. A policeman
test.C: C. A stop sign
test.D: D. A flashing red light

test.question: You may cross a double solid yellow line:
test.A: A. To pass a slow moving truck
test.B: B. To turn into a driveway
test.C: C. To pass a car if traffic permits
test.D: D. Under no conditions

test.question: You may not cross a single broken white (or yellow) line:
test.A: A. When to do so would interfere with traffic
test.B: B. When turning left into a driveway
test.C: C. When the car in front is disabled
test.D: D. When passing to the right on a one-way street

test.question: What are the colors of a sign which tells you the distance to the next exit of a highway?
test.A: A. Yellow with black letters
test.B: B. Black with white letters
test.C: C. Red with white letters
test.D: D. Green with white letters

test.question: A traffic light which has a green arrow and a red light means that:
test.A: A. You may only drive straight ahead
test.B: B. You may drive only in the direction of the green arrow
test.C: C. You must wait for a green light
test.D: D. Vehicles moving in any direction must stop

test.question: What are the colors of the warning signs that indicate hazards ahead, such as curves in the road or narrow bridges?
test.A: A. Black letters or symbols on a white background
test.B: B. Black letters or symbols on a yellow background
test.C: C. White letters or symbols on a blue background
test.D: D. White letters or symbols on a green background

test.question: You come to an intersection which has a flashing red light.  You should:
test.A: A. Come to a full stop, then go when safe to do so
test.B: B. Stop only if cars are approaching the intersection
test.C: C. Stop only if cars are already in the intersection
test.D: D. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

test.question: An intersection has a stop sign and a crosswalk, but no stop line.  You must stop:
test.A: A. Before the crosswalk
test.B: B. 50 feet before the intersection
test.C: C. Where you think the stop line would be
test.D: D. With your front wheels in the crosswalk

test.question: When the road is marked with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line on your side you may pass:
test.A: A. Only in an emergency
test.B: B. If you are on an expressway
test.C: C. If traffic is clear
test.D: D. Only at an intersection

test.question: A rectangular-shaped sign is a:
test.A: A. Railroad crossing sign
test.B: B. School crossing sign
test.C: C. Speed limit sign
test.D: D. Stop sign

test.question: What does a flashing yellow light mean?
test.A: A. Merging traffic
test.B: B. Proceed with caution
test.C: C. Pedestrian crossing
test.D: D. Come to a full stop

test.question: What does this road sign mean?
test.A: A. Slow down and prepare to stop only if cars are approaching you
test.B: B. Come to a full stop, then go when it is safe to do so
test.C: C. Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping
test.D: D. Stop only for traffic on an intersecting road

test.question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
test.A: A. Road hazard sign
test.B: B. Interstate route site
test.C: C. School crossing sign
test.D: D. Speed limit sign

test.question: A solid white line on the right edge of the highway slants in toward your left.  This shows that:
test.A: A. There is an intersection just ahead
test.B: B. You are approaching a construction area
test.C: C. You will be required to turn left just ahead
test.D: D. The road will get narrower

test.question: A red and white triangular sign at an intersection means:
test.A: A. Always come to a full stop at the intersection
test.B: B. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
test.C: C. Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching
test.D: D. Look both ways as you cross the intersection

test.question: Which of the following is used on some highways to direct drivers into the proper lanes for turning?
test.A: A. Flashing red lights
test.B: B. Flashing yellow lights
test.C: C. White lines on the side of the road
test.D: D. White arrows in the middle of the lanes

test.question: The driver's left arm and hand are extended downward.  This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
test.A: A. Turn left
test.B: B. Turn right
test.C: C. Stop
test.D: D. Start up

test.question: You must pull over and stop for:
test.A: A. Vehicles that display blue, green or amber lights
test.B: B. Authorized emergency vehicles responding to emergencies
test.C: C. A hazard vehicle that is parked, stopped or standing on any part of the highway
test.D: D. Stopped or standing school buses

test.question: What should you do when you are going to enter a roadway from a private road?
test.A: A. Blow your horn to warn cars you are entering the roadway
test.B: B. Stop with part of the car on the roadway to warn other drivers
test.C: C. Drive out fast to merge smoothly with the traffic
test.D: D. Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and roadway traffic

test.question: You come to an intersection which is blocked by other traffic.  You should:
test.A: A. Go slowly until the traffic ahead moves
test.B: B. Get as close as possible to the other car
test.C: C. Stay out of the intersection until you can pass through
test.D: D. Sound your horn to make the cars move up

test.question: You want to turn right at the next intersection.  You should begin to use your turn signal:
test.A: A. At least 50 feet before the turn
test.B: B. When you reach the intersection
test.C: C. At least 100 feet before you turn
test.D: D. As soon as you see cars behind you

test.question: When you want to make a right turn, your car must be:
test.A: A. Near the center of the street
test.B: B. Close to the left side of the street
test.C: C. Close to the right side of the street
test.D: D. Past the center of the intersection when you begin to turn

test.question: You are making a left turn away from a two-way street into a one-way street.  When you have completed the turn your car should be:
test.A: A. In the right lane of the street
test.B: B. In the center of the street
test.C: C. In the left lane of the street
test.D: D. In the lane with the least traffic

test.question: You are waiting in the intersection to complete a left turn.  You should:
test.A: A. Signal and keep your wheels turned to the left
test.B: B. Signal and keep your wheels straight
test.C: C. Flash your headlights so the driver will let you through
test.D: D. Drive around the rear of a car if it blocks you

test.question: The driver's left hand and arm are extended upward.  This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
test.A: A. Turn left
test.B: B. Turn right
test.C: C. Come to a stop
test.D: D. Go straight ahead

test.question: You drive along a street and hear a siren.  You cannot immediately see the emergency vehicle.  You should:
test.A: A. Keep driving until you see the vehicle
test.B: B. Pull to the curb and look to see if it is on your street
test.C: C. Slow down but don't stop until you see it
test.D: D. Speed up and turn at the next intersection

test.question: When two vehicles enter an intersection from different highways at the same time, which vehicle must yield the right-of-way?
test.A: A. Either one
test.B: B. Vehicle on the left
test.C: C. Vehicle on the right
test.D: D. Neither one

test.question: When you see an emergency vehicle parked, stopped, or standing with its emergency or hazard lights activated on a highway or parkway, you should:
test.A: A. Move out of the lane closest to the emergency vehicle, if possible to do so safely
test.B: B. Make a U-turn to avoid the vehicle
test.C: C. Maintain your speed and lane position if possible
test.D: D. Stop behind the vehicle and activate your hazard lights

test.question: The law that requires every driver to exercise care to avoid colliding with an authorized emergency or hazard vehicle is called:
test.A: A. Briannaâ€™s Law
test.B: B. The Green Light Law
test.C: C. Move Over Law
test.D: D. Right of Way

test.question: You must yield the right-of-way to an approaching vehicle when you are:
test.A: A. Already in a traffic circle
test.B: B. Already in an intersection
test.C: C. Going straight ahead
test.D: D. Turning left

test.question: You want to turn left at an intersection.  The light is green but oncoming traffic is heavy.  You should:
test.A: A. Use the next intersection
test.B: B. Wait at the crosswalk for traffic to clear
test.C: C. Wait in the center of the intersection for traffic to clear
test.D: D. Take the right-of-way since you have the light

test.question: You have the right of way when you are:
test.A: A. Entering a traffic circle
test.B: B. Backing out of a driveway
test.C: C. Leaving a parking space
test.D: D. Already in a traffic circle

test.question: What does it mean when a school bus is stopped and its red lights are flashing?
test.A: A. You may pass if no children are on the road
test.B: B. You may not pass while the red lights are flashing
test.C: C. You may pass if you are facing the front of the bus
test.D: D. You may pass if it is on the other side of a divided highway

test.question: After you have passed a car you should return to the right lane when you:
test.A: A. See the front bumper of the other car in your mirror
test.B: B. Have put your turn signal on
test.C: C. Have turned your headlights on
test.D: D. See the other car's headlights come on

test.question: When you want to overtake and pass another vehicle you should:
test.A: A. Wait for a signal from the other driver
test.B: B. Change lanes quickly so the other driver will see you
test.C: C. Signal and pass when safe to do so
test.D: D. Stay close behind so you need less time to pass

test.question: You are driving in the middle lane on a three lane expressway.  A car begins to pass you on the right.  The actions of that driver are:
test.A: A. Wrong because "pass on the left" is a firm rule
test.B: B. Wrong because he's passing you in your "blind spot"
test.C: C. OK as long as he does it on a limited access highway
test.D: D. OK if no signs forbid passing on the right

test.question: The car behind you begins to pass you.  You should:
test.A: A. Maintain your speed so traffic will flow smoothly
test.B: B. Pull to the right and stop so he can pass
test.C: C. Slow down slightly and stay in your lane
test.D: D. Blow your horn to allow him to pass

test.question: In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction you are going:
test.A: A. On the right
test.B: B. On the left
test.C: C. Only if the other driver signals it is safe
test.D: D. Whenever you have the opportunity to do so

test.question: In which of the following situations is passing always forbidden?
test.A: A. The vehicle ahead is making a left turn
test.B: B. You are on a one-way street which has two lanes
test.C: C. The vehicle ahead is stopped for a pedestrian in a crosswalk
test.D: D. The vehicle ahead is going to park parallel to the curb

test.question: You may pass another vehicle on the right if it is waiting to:
test.A: A. Turn right
test.B: B. Turn left
test.C: C. Park at the curb
test.D: D. Turn into a driveway on the right

test.question: A "no standing" sign at a certain location means:
test.A: A. You may never stop your vehicle there
test.B: B. You may park there if the driver remains in the vehicle
test.C: C. You may stop temporarily to pick up or discharge passengers
test.D: D. You may stop to load or unload merchandise

test.question: A driver may park in a space reserved for people with disabilities if the vehicle displays license plates for the disabled:
test.A: A. Regardless of who is in the vehicle
test.B: B. Only if the driver is disabled
test.C: C. And is carrying a disabled person named on the registration
test.D: D. If someone in the driver's immediate family is disabled

test.question: A "no stopping" sign means that, unless directed to do so by a policeman, you may stop only:
test.A: A. Long enough to unload packages
test.B: B. To avoid conflict with other traffic
test.C: C. To discharge passengers
test.D: D. For less than 5 minutes

test.question: In a parking space reserved for people with disabilities, a non-disabled driver:
test.A: A. May park in an emergency
test.B: B. May not park, but stop in an emergency
test.C: C. May not park or stop, but may stand in an emergency
test.D: D. May neither park, stop, nor stand

test.question: Before you leave a parking space which is parallel to the curb, you should:
test.A: A. Sound your horn
test.B: B. Turn on your four-way flasher
test.C: C. Look for traffic by turning your head
test.D: D. Look for traffic by using your inside rear-view mirror

test.question: If you are parked parallel to the curb, you may get out of the car on the traffic side:
test.A: A. During the daytime when other drivers can see you
test.B: B. When the traffic light at the closest intersection turns red
test.C: C. When you won't interfere with oncoming vehicles
test.D: D. If you use your four-way flasher first

test.question: Assuming that the street is level, what should you do after you have finished parallel parking in a space between two other cars?
test.A: A. Leave your front wheels turned toward the curb
test.B: B. Make sure your car almost touches the car behind you
test.C: C. Move as far forward in the space as possible
test.D: D. Straighten your front wheels and leave room between cars

test.question: A "no parking" sign at a certain location means:
test.A: A. You may never stop your vehicle there
test.B: B. You may stop temporarily to load or unload passengers
test.C: C. You may park there if the driver remains in the vehicle
test.D: D. You may leave your vehicle unattended for less than 5 minutes

test.question: You may never park:
test.A: A. On a one-way street
test.B: B. At the entrance of a building
test.C: C. In a crosswalk
test.D: D. Within 50 feet of a fire hydrant

test.question: One of the rules of defensive driving is:
test.A: A. Look straight ahead as you drive
test.B: B. Stay alert and keep your eyes moving
test.C: C. Expect that other drivers will make up for your errors
test.D: D. Be confident that you can avoid danger at the last minute

test.question: Signs that warn "lane closed ahead" may indicate a work zone ahead. You should:
test.A: A. Merge your vehicle into the correct lane when it is safe
test.B: B. Drive to the end of the closed lane before attempting to merge
test.C: C. Understand that this sign is merely a suggestion and continue in the lane
test.D: D. Speed up to merge as quickly as possible

test.question: Seat belts can be most effective as injury preventive devices when they are worn by:
test.A: A. The person driving the car
test.B: B. Passengers when they are on a long drive
test.C: C. All occupants of a car being driven on an expressway
test.D: D. Passengers and the driver whenever they are in the car

test.question: Minimum speed signs are designed to:
test.A: A. Keep traffic flowing smoothly
test.B: B. Show current local road conditions
test.C: C. Test future traffic signal needs
test.D: D. Assure pedestrian safety

test.question: Which of the following may describe a work zone sign?
test.A: A. A white rectangle with black letters
test.B: B. An orange diamond with black letters
test.C: C. A green rectangle with white letters
test.D: D. A yellow circle with black letters

test.question: Driving in a state of rage can:
test.A: A. Affect your ability to reason and make decisions
test.B: B. Increase the chance of being involved in a traffic accident
test.C: C. Lead to a revoked or suspended license
test.D: D. All of these choices

test.question: What is true of work zones?
test.A: A. They are always stationary and therefore easily avoided
test.B: B. They are only dangerous at night
test.C: C. Speeding fines are tripled when workers are present
test.D: D. Rear-end collisions are the most common type of crash in work zones

test.question: A safe speed to drive your car:
test.A: A. Is the posted speed limit
test.B: B. Is less than the posted speed limit
test.C: C. Depends on the weather and road conditions
test.D: D. Depends on the mechanical skill of the driver

test.question: On long trips you can prevent drowsiness by:
test.A: A. Turning on your car radio
test.B: B. Slowing down so you can react better
test.C: C. Stopping at regular intervals for a rest
test.D: D. Moving your eyes from side to side as you drive

test.question: Which of the following is always true about road rage?
test.A: A. There is nothing a driver can do to prevent road rage
test.B: B. You must hold your position in your travel lane
test.C: C. Only violent people experience road rage
test.D: D. You should remain polite to aggressive drivers

test.question: Aggressive driving can become road rage. What should you do when confronted by an aggressive driver?
test.A: A. Speed up to pass the driver as quickly as possible
test.B: B. Be prepared to yield the right of way
test.C: C. Drink alcohol to calm yourself down
test.D: D. Make eye contact with the driver

test.question: On a New York State highway where there is no posted speed limit, the fastest you may legally drive is:
test.A: A. 50 mph
test.B: B. 55 mph
test.C: C. 60 mph
test.D: D. 65 mph

test.question: What effect does drinking alcohol and taking a prescription drug or over the counter medicine have?
test.A: A. The medicine reduces the effect of the alcohol
test.B: B. The alcohol will help the medicine cure the cold
test.C: C. The combination could multiply the effects of the alcohol
test.D: D. No effect, they are difference substances

test.question: On average, the human body can dispose of the alcohol in 12 ounces of beer in about:
test.A: A. One hour
test.B: B. One day
test.C: C. Five minutes
test.D: D. Five hours

test.question: Which of the following is true?  People driving under the influence of alcohol are:
test.A: A. Not a problem in New York State
test.B: B. Every driver's problem whether they drink or not
test.C: C. A police enforcement problem only
test.D: D. Only a problem to those who drink

test.question: Drinking coffee after drinking alcohol:
test.A: A. Decreases blood alcohol content
test.B: B. Cancels the effect of the alcohol
test.C: C. Has no effect on blood alcohol content
test.D: D. Increases blood alcohol content

test.question: Which of the following statements is true about BAC (blood alcohol content)?
test.A: A. The "breathalyzer" is a test of a person's BAC
test.B: B. A chemical test for BAC is needed for an alcohol conviction
test.C: C. BAC levels are reduced by a person's physical fitness
test.D: D. After drinking, coffee or a cold shower will lower your BAC

test.question: Drinking alcohol and driving is:
test.A: A. A minor traffic safety problem
test.B: B. A serious traffic safety problem
test.C: C. Safe if you only have a few drinks
test.D: D. Only dangerous to the driver who drinks

test.question: Which of the following does not happen after drinking?
test.A: A. Your reflexes and reaction time slow down
test.B: B. Your judgment of speed and distance is distorted
test.C: C. You are less alert
test.D: D. You calm down so you can concentrate

test.question: If you drink alcohol socially, what helps ensure safe driving?
test.A: A. Drink coffee before driving
test.B: B. Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking
test.C: C. Take a cold shower before driving
test.D: D. Stop drinking one half hour before driving

test.question: What kinds of drugs, other than alcohol, can affect your driving ability?
test.A: A. An allergy medicine
test.B: B. Marijuana
test.C: C. A cold remedy
test.D: D. All of these choices

test.question: What happens to your driver's license if you refuse to take a chemical test (breath or blood)?
test.A: A. There is no evidence to find you guilty of drunk driving
test.B: B. You cannot be arrested for drunk driving
test.C: C. Your driver's license will be taken away
test.D: D. None of these choices

test.question: A chemical test is used to measure:
test.A: A. Reaction time
test.B: B. Blood alcohol content
test.C: C. Vision
test.D: D. Driving ability

test.question: Which of the following does alcohol affect?
test.A: A. Recovery from hadlight glare
test.B: B. Reaction time
test.C: C. Judgment of distances
test.D: D. All of these choices

test.question: What is the only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC)?
test.A: A. Drinking coffee
test.B: B. Exercising
test.C: C. Allow your body time to get rid of alcohol
test.D: D. Taking a cold shower

test.question: What does alcohol do to your driving skills and judgment?
test.A: A. It helps driving skills but harms your judgment
test.B: B. It harms both driving skills and judgment
test.C: C. It has no effect on either driving skills or judgment
test.D: D. It has no effect on judgment but it harms driving skills

test.question: What are the consequences that can result from driving under the influence of alcohol or other drugs?
test.A: A. Possible imprisonment
test.B: B. A mandatory fine
test.C: C. Driver license revocation
test.D: D. All of these choices

test.question: In this state, what BAC (blood alcohol content) is evidence of intoxication?
Blood alcohol content (BAC) depends on each of the following except:
test.A: A. Your body weight
test.B: B. How much you drink
test.C: C. How much time passes between drinks
test.D: D. How physically fit you are

test.question: A driver who is taking a non-prescription drug should:
test.A: A. Read the labels on the drug before driving
test.B: B. Drink alcohol instead
test.C: C. Continue to drive
test.D: D. Drive only during daylight hours

test.question: What effect might alcohol and another drug have when combined in your blood?
test.A: A. Increase the effects of both
test.B: B. Have no effect on driving ability
test.C: C. Reduce the effects of the drug or medicine
test.D: D. Reduce the effects of the alcohol

test.question: Which of the following influence the effects of alcohol?
test.A: A. The amount of food in the stomach
test.B: B. The body weight of an individual
test.C: C. How much time passes between drinks
test.D: D. All three choices

test.question: What is the appropriate action to take when approaching a railroad crossing that does not have signals (such as lights or crossing gates)?
test.A: A. Always bring the car to a complete stop
test.B: B. Slow down and be prepared to stop
test.C: C. Do nothing; all railroad crosings have signals
test.D: D. Increase speed to get across the tracks quickly

test.question: You have just left an expressway and are starting to drive on an ordinary highway.  You should:
test.A: A. Check your tires for correct pressure
test.B: B. Check your speedometer to keep at the lower speed limit
test.C: C. Stay twice as far behind other cars
test.D: D. Change gradually to the lower speed limit

test.question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
test.A: A. An intersection
test.B: B. A crosswalk
test.C: C. A railroad crossing
test.D: D. A blasting zone

test.question: Expressways have "expressway entrance lanes" (acceleration lanes) so that drivers can:
test.A: A. Test their brakes before driving at expressway speeds
test.B: B. Stop at the end to wait for a traffic opening
test.C: C. Reach the proper speed before blending with traffic
test.D: D. Test the pickup of their cars

test.question: Expressways have "expressway entrance lanes" (acceleration lanes) so that drivers can:
test.A: A. Test their brakes before driving at expressway speeds
test.B: B. Stop at the end to wait for a traffic opening
test.C: C. Reach the proper speed before blending with traffic
test.D: D. Test the pickup of their cars

test.question: If an approaching train is near enough or going fast enough to be a danger, you must:
test.A: A. Slow down and proceed with caution
test.B: B. Not cross the tracks until the train has completely passed
test.C: C. Cross the tracks at your own risk
test.D: D. Find an alternative route across tracks

test.question: Your car starts to skid on a slippery road.  You should:
test.A: A. Brake quickly and keep the wheel straight
test.B: B. Lock your brakes until you have come to a complete stop
test.C: C. Steer in the direction you want the front wheels to go
test.D: D. Steer toward the side of the road to get off the wet pavement

test.question: When driving at night, it is most important for you to:
test.A: A. Use your high beams at all times
test.B: B. Drive within range of your headlights
test.C: C. Be ready to brake more quickly
test.D: D. Watch for cars at intersections

test.question: Which of the following statements applies to all driving emergency situations?
test.A: A. Always slow down gradually
test.B: B. Your first reaction is the best reaction
test.C: C. Think before you act
test.D: D. Apply your brakes immediately

test.question: When you get ready to leave an expressway, you should begin to use your turn signal:
test.A: A. Just as you get to the exit ramp
test.B: B. 50 feet before the exit ramp
test.C: C. 100 feet before the exit ramp
test.D: D. When you see cars behind you in the exit lane

test.question: If traffic prevents you from crossing all the way across a set of railroad tracks, you may proceed only when:
test.A: A. An approaching train is not moving fast enough to be a danger
test.B: B. There is room for your vehicle on the other side
test.C: C. At least one half of your vehicle can cross the tracks
test.D: D. No trains are in sight

test.question: You may drive around or under a gate that is being lowered or raised at a railroad crossing:
test.A: A. As long as an approaching train is not too close
test.B: B. If your vehicle can do so without damaging the gate
test.C: C. If you first look carefully in both directions
test.D: D. Under no circumstances

test.question: When your right wheels run onto a soft shoulder, what is the best way to get back on the highway?
test.A: A. Apply the brakes firmly and steer gently to the left
test.B: B. Ease your foot off the gas and brake gently
test.C: C. Steer hard to the left and then gently to the right
test.D: D. Apply the brakes firmly and stop completely

test.question: What vehicles must stop at all railroad crossings?
test.A: A. Pickup trucks
test.B: B. School buses and passenger buses carrying passengers
test.C: C. Motorcycles
test.D: D. Vehicles towing a trailer

test.question: When attempting to stop on a slippery road, the best action to take is:
test.A: A. Apply the brakes quickly and firmly
test.B: B. Apply the brakes in slow, steady strokes
test.C: C. Shift to a lower gear, do not use the brakes
test.D: D. Shift into neutral, do not use the brakes

test.question: When you drive at night you an reduce the problem of glare from the headlights of an approaching car by:
test.A: A. Looking to the lower right side of your lane
test.B: B. Having the inside lights on to make the amount of light equal
test.C: C. Looking at the spot on the lower edge of the steering wheel
test.D: D. Wearing glasses with lightly tinted lenses

test.question: If you drive past your exit on an expressway, you should:
test.A: A. Pull onto the shoulder, then back up to the exit
test.B: B. Drive to the next exit and leave the expressway
test.C: C. Make a U-turn at the nearest emergency turn area
test.D: D. Make a U-turn at the next service area

test.question: When you drive in heavy fog during daylight hours you should drive with your:
test.A: A. Headlights off
test.B: B. Parking lights on
test.C: C. Headlights on low beam
test.D: D. Headlights on high beam

test.question: You are getting on a highway which has a very short entrance lane.  The safest way for you to enter the flow of traffic would be to:
test.A: A. Use as much ramp as possible to get up to cruising speed
test.B: B. Use the left lane of the highway to get up to ruising speed
test.C: C. Wait for a large gap in traffic then speed up quickly
test.D: D. Get up to cruising speed gradually so other cars will see you

test.question: Night driving is dangerous because:
test.A: A. Some traffic signs are less visible at night
test.B: B. More vehicles are on the road at night
test.C: C. The distance we can see ahead is reduced
test.D: D. Street lights tend to blur our vision

test.question: Why is driving on an expressway different from driving on an ordinary street?
test.A: A. You must think faster and handle your vehicle more effectively
test.B: B. Trucks have to go slower on the expressways
test.C: C. There is more of a tendency to exceed the speed limit
test.D: D. There is more of a tendency to "tailgate"

test.question: If your brake pedal suddenly sinks to the floor, you should first:
test.A: A. Try to pump it to build up the pressure
test.B: B. Shift into neutral and shut the engine off
test.C: C. Try to raise it by hooking your toe under it
test.D: D. Apply the parking brake hard to stop the car

test.question: If a tire blows out, the proper thing to do is:
test.A: A. Speed up to gain traction and then pull to the right
test.B: B. Hold the steering wheel firmly, and ease up on the gas
test.C: C. Apply the brakes, then shift into neutral
test.D: D. Shift into neutral, then apply the brakes

test.question: Motorists should be aware that all bicycles used after dark must have:
test.A: A. Reflective handlebar grips
test.B: B. A front headlight and red tailight
test.C: C. White reflectors on the front and rear fenders
test.D: D. Brake lights

test.question: On a road which has no sidewalks a pedestrian should walk on the:
test.A: A. Side of the road which has the lightest traffic
test.B: B. Same side of the road in which traffic is moving
test.C: C. Side of the road facing oncoming traffic
test.D: D. Side of the road which has the heaviest traffic

test.question: Where should you stop at a crosswalk to ensure other vehicles are able to see the crossing?
test.A: A. Before or at the stop line before you enter the crosswalk
test.B: B. 5 feet before the crosswalk
test.C: C. Drive directly into the crosswalk so that all vehicles can see it
test.D: D. 10 feet before the crosswalk

test.question: A motorist should know that a bicyclist operating on a roadway must:
test.A: A. Ride on the right side of the road
test.B: B. Ride on the side of the road facing traffic
test.C: C. Ride on either side of the road
test.D: D. Ride on the side of the road with the least traffic

test.question: Do you need to yield to pedestrians in unmarked crosswalks?
test.A: A. No, the vehicle has the right of way
test.B: B. Yes
test.C: C. Only after sunset
test.D: D. Only if the pedestrian uses hand signals to indicate that they are crossing

test.question: A motorist approaching a bicyclist should:
test.A: A. Speed up to pass him
test.B: B. Proceed as usual
test.C: C. Swerve into the opposite lane
test.D: D. Exercise extreme caution

test.question: When passing a bicyclist, what action should you take?
test.A: A. Slow down
test.B: B. Alert the bicyclist of your presence with your horn
test.C: C. Stop, then pass when it is safe to do so
test.D: D. Do nothing

test.question: What rights or responsibilities do bicyclists have for sharing the roadway?
test.A: A. Bicyclists should not be on the roadway
test.B: B. Bicyclists have the same rights and responsibilities as pedestrians
test.C: C. Bicyclists have the same rights and responsibilities as motorists
test.D: D. Bicyclists do not have to yield the right of way for pedestrians

test.question: When operating a vehicle, when might you see a pedestrian?
test.A: A. At rush hour
test.B: B. Only at marked crosswalks
test.C: C. When driving through a busy intersection
test.D: D. At any moment

test.question: What does a "slow moving vehicle" emblem look like?
test.A: A. A square red sign
test.B: B. A round green sign
test.C: C. A diamond-shaped yellow sign
test.D: D. A triangular orange sign

test.question: You want to back out of your driveway.  You see children playing nearby.  Before you start to move your car you should:
test.A: A. Race your motor to warn the children that you are moving
test.B: B. Sound your horn so the children will hear you
test.C: C. Walk to the back of the car to be sure the way is clear
test.D: D. Tell the children to stay away from the driveway

test.question: A bicyclist differs from a motorist in that he isn't required to:
test.A: A. Obey the same traffic laws
test.B: B. Signal all turns
test.C: C. Report accidents resulting in serious injury
test.D: D. Insure the bicycle

test.question: A blind person legally has the right-of-way when crossing the street when he is:
test.A: A. Wearing light-colored clothing
test.B: B. Led by a guide dog, or using a white or metallic cane
test.C: C. Helped by another person
test.D: D. Wearing dark-colored glasses

test.question: When should a driver yield to a pedestrian or bicyclist?
test.A: A. When the pedestrian has a service animal
test.B: B. Always yield to pedestrians and slow down for bicyclists
test.C: C. When the pedestrian or bicyclist is a minor
test.D: D. There is no need to yield, the road is shared

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Highway changes ahead to the right
test.B: B. Hiking trails ahead to the right
test.C: C. Hotel ahead to the right
test.D: D. Hospital ahead to the right

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Divided highway ends
test.B: B. One-way traffic ahead
test.C: C. Two-way traffic ahead
test.D: D. Keep to the right

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Four-lane traffic ahead
test.B: B. Divided highway ahead
test.C: C. Two-way traffic ahead
test.D: D. Intersection ahead

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. All traffic turn left
test.B: B. No left turn
test.C: C. No U-turn
test.D: D. Truck route to the left

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching
test.B: B. Look both ways as you cross the intersection
test.C: C. Always come to a full stop at the intersection
test.D: D. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Continue at your current speed
test.B: B. You must stop ahead
test.C: C. Speeding is not allowed
test.D: D. There is a traffic signal ahead

test.question: This sign is used to prevent:
test.A: A. Entrance to full parking lots
test.B: B. Entrance to road construction areas
test.C: C. Entrance to dead-end streets
test.D: D. Wrong-way entrance on one-way streets and expressway ramps

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. No left turn
test.B: B. No stopping
test.C: C. No U-turn
test.D: D. Detour ahead

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. One-way traffic
test.B: B. Intersection ahead
test.C: C. Merging traffic from the right
test.D: D. Highway curves ahead

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Merging traffic is approaching from the right
test.B: B. Winding road ahead
test.C: C. Right lane ends, stay to the left
test.D: D. Divided highway ahead

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Pedestrians only
test.B: B. Intersection ahead
test.C: C. Hiking trails ahead
test.D: D. School crossing ahead

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Divided highway ahead
test.B: B. One-way taffic ahead
test.C: C. Four-lane highway ahead
test.D: D. Divided highway ends

test.question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
test.A: A. An intersection
test.B: B. A crosswalk
test.C: C. A railroad crossing
test.D: D. A blasting zone

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Trucks under 18,000 lbs. allowed
test.B: B. Hill ahead
test.C: C. Truck stop ahead
test.D: D. No trucks allowed

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Don't drink if you are going to drive
test.B: B. Slippery when wet
test.C: C. Road curves ahead
test.D: D. You are approaching a hill

test.question: This sign means:
test.A: A. Slow down and prepare to stop only if cars are approaching you
test.B: B. Come to a full stop, then go when it is safe to do so
test.C: C. Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping
test.D: D. Stop only for traffic on an intersecting road
